usefulItems: bowl, nut milk bag or muslin cloth, jug
title: Rice milk

ingredients.content: 1400 g water, plus extra for soaking

preparations.content: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh rice and almonds into it. Cover with warm water and set aside to soak overnight.
Drain rice and almonds. Place 1000 g of the water, soaked rice and almonds into mixing bowl and blend <b>1 min/speed 9<b>.
Add coconut oil (optional), honey (optional) and salt and cook <b>5 min/60°C/speed 4<b>, then blend <b>1 min/speed 9<b>.
Add remaining 400 g water and mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Place a nut milk bag or muslin cloth over a jug and strain milk through it. Discard solids and set milk aside to cool, then use as needed.

hintsAndTricks: For a nut free alternative, omit the almonds and increase the brown rice to 160 g.
You can replace the almonds with cashews in this recipe - it will yield a smoother, creamier milk.
For a quicker version, soak the almonds and rice in boiling water for 30 minutes (your milk will have a milder flavour compared to soaking it overnight).
